content:
Posted: November 15, 2016
												Gee this is a tough one. Price - 20mins for $20us is a bit steep. Then I suppose you got to expect that when companies are aiming at a small target. Still not worth it in my eyes.Replay - zero to maybe.For the vive this is greatly cut back for the psvr. It really made me think how lucky I am to own a vive. Anyway the review - if you get motion sickness steer clear as there are a few flying with no controlling movement moments. There is 4 areas that you sit and do very small tasks to move the story on. Example throw big potatoes into the big bucket and small potatoes in the small bucket. Yep that's how exciting this experience is. Besides that you watch quick 5sec clips that are displayed like big screen beta all over the place to make it seem exciting I supposeI give this the thumbs down. Didn't go much on the movie and I think the movie is better than this!

content:
Posted: November 15, 2016
												First off, neat experience but that is just about it. It was only 4 different short 5 minute segments unfortunatly... Pratically no replay unless you enjoy throwing potatoes and drive a rover around.The audience just isn't right. I'd expect something like this at a convention or at a movie theatre to get people interested in a movie or the possibilities. For first timers, this is a real wow moment. For those that have had their vives and building up a library, not at all.Did I have fun? Yes and no. It is a shame that the PSVR crippled you to sit in a seat though opposed to actually walking around. Though on the other hand, it was really HQ compared to others out there and I did feel a bit of a rush during one part.Would I recommend it? For $5 or less, sure. Not $20.

			This is The Martian VR Experience HTC Vive Gameplay in Virtual Reality! Wow guys, we are actually gonna travel into space and land on Mars in VR, perform tasks in our spaceship and explore space and...		

This is The Martian VR Experience HTC Vive Gameplay in Virtual Reality! Wow guys, we are actually gonna travel into space and land on Mars in VR, perform tasks in our spaceship and explore space and zero gravity in Virtual Reality like never before! The Martian VR Experience is an long awaited VR title, sponsored by huge movie companies, and the immersion is promised to be amazing in VR. Doesn´t that sound great? Well... it is, but its also a BIG lie! I'm not going to spoil this gameplay for you until you have seen my video, but all I can say is that I am disappointed. VERY DISAPPOINTED! Anyhow, judge for yourself, but The Martian VR Experience is actually supposed to be a big title. This is a hyped-up VR experience available both for HTC Vive, Oculus Rift as well as Playstation VR. But unfortunately it is not even close to what it could have been...Im sorry, but this "game" doesnt deserve a positive review. Maybe for 5 Eur, but not 20. Shame on you, guys!

number of helpful: 39 of 44 people (89%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 15, 2016
												I haven't read any reviews/previews on this, but I did see the movie. So what's my opinion?   I can summarize it in three words :  short but sweet!It's definitely a high quality title, but it's also a short experience that will (only) last a little longer than 20 minutes. High quality because of the presentation, the beautiful visuals made with UE4,  the high immersion, the way they built up the mini-chapters (they get better as the experience progresses), and the way they alternate between VR and clips from the movie. Very well-made and certainly a good title to demo to your friends that never tried VR before.Is it perfect? Nothing is.  Personally I feel that you're pushed forward even when you would like to enjoy the scenery a little longer. So after a few minutes, the screen fades to black and you are pushed into the next chapter of the experience. There's zero freedom. It could also be confusing for people that haven't seen the movie. I can imagine they won't always know what's going on.Last, yes for 20 minutes it's very expensive.  This is the same comment that the Everest VR Experience received and I have to agree with that.  Price should have been lower.If you love the Everest experience, you will certainly love this one too.  If you didn't or you thought it was too expensive, then skip this one.  Personally, I love them both, but I can't really recommend because of the price and the short duration of this (wonderful) experience.

number of helpful: 12 of 13 people (92%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 22, 2016
												When I first heard about this I thought "yes of course!". The story of Mark Watney (which I loved in book and movie form) would be a *perfect* match for VR tech, and Vive Roomscale in particular. I was impatiently waiting for it to be released...and finally, when it came out this month, I immediately bought it (didn't really care about the price).Well... I do like the graphics. For the most part feels like a polished product visually; some parts even look great, both on Mars and in space. There are moments when I like the "interactive movie" atmosphere a lot; I think the combination of VR scenes and clips from the movie is very neat and really works.However when I think what this could have been (given the source material) I am sorry to say it looks like a trainwreck. The very few actual VR scenes, while not bad in terms of visual immersion, are, for the most part, just mind-numbingly boring. Sorting potatoes? Pushing buttons? Come on!!! Where is the roomscale "walk on Mars"? Come to think of it, I would have been perfectly happy just to be able to sit in the cramped rover (without a weird time limit) and, well,  EXPERIENCE it in VR... with may be a Martian dust storm going on outside. But whoever made this decided not to include *anything* even remotely awe-inspiring. Instead, they went with a small collection of stupid mini-games that feel like a first grader came up with the ideas for them.In short: Somebody put in a lot of effort to make it beautiful-looking, but forgot to actually include the "Martian Experience". I am hugely disappointed and can't recommend it at all. Honestly, I don't care so much that I paid too much for this... to me it is much worse that they completely ruined this great opportunity.

number of helpful: 7 of 8 people (88%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 15, 2016
												Requested refund. 19.99 is far far too much for what turns out to be such a shallow promotional product. Even if I were prompted to try this for free in a cinema lobby or at some kind of convention - which is exactly the kind of product this feels like -  I would come away extremely underwhelmed, and probably confused as to what the fuss over VR is.It is mostly an FMV game, in which you watch clips from the movie floating in front of you, with the lightest of VR gameplay possible tacked on at intervals. From the very first moments alarm bells start ringing when you're prompted to awkwardly hold out your arms and look at a small target to calibrate. Even worse are follow-up moments in which you're a disembodied camera speeding over a landscape, then disorientatingly locked to the character's motion. I was presented with a table of potatoes that I could pick up and throw into buckets, but was at a loss as to what to do once there was nothing left, as just sat around looking for more "game" until it eventually decided to load up another few clips. This game seems to be full of bad choices that break VR Design 101, I would not be using this as a representation of VR's capabilites to anyone.Even by the already overpriced standards of VR titles, this is a complete ripoff, there is no value here.

content:
Posted: January 22
												Let me just start by saying I'm a huge fan of The Martian book and movie.This is a pretty terrible VR experience all in all. There are even some inconsistenies with the VR Experience's "story" as compared to the movie and the book.There are 3-4 interactive portions where you push buttons, throw things and "Iron Man" your way to the Hermes at the end of the movie.The rest is video clips from the movie randomly appearing in front of you.This is not worth any amount of money even if you're a huge fan. It should have been a free promotional packin with the movie or just free period. I can't even recommend getting it on sale unless it's free.
